ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: general genetic analysis techniques, more importantly an understanding of the logic of these techniques and why they work
Fundamentals of DNA based research, the "why" behind standard lab techniques

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: pretty relaxed format, relatively little work outside of class until the end, useful to understand how the techniques work conceptually as well, has a decent amount of downtime during the lab just by the structure of the experiments which is helpful in a long class
Weaknesses: course wasn't super organized or clear on what would be happening but honestly this wasn't that big of a deal, doubt I'll remember that much techniques-wise but I think that's just a broader issue with teaching labs
Very interesting and real world, could be more efficient

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, definitely the best lab class I've taken at yale (out of three, but still). Definitely useful to both get some experience doing the techniques but also hear about how and why they work on a more basic level. Pretty relaxed as a class format like you can walk in and out of lab during incubations and stuff and the work for most of the semester is pretty light and can just be done during the class time except for the final paper.
Yeah! A fabulous MCDB class that anyone who needs a lab requirement should consider. It can be redundant, however, if you are already doing genetic work in lab

extras.title: MCDB 342L 01 - Laboratory in Nucleic Acids I
